title: How to Make Photo Coasters

steps.headline: Print off or cut out the photo that you want to use and trim the edges to fit the ceramic tiles.
Apply Mod Podge to the back of the photo using the sponge applicator, and carefully place it on the ceramic tile.
steps.description: Be sure to move quickly because Mod Podge is not very forgiving.

steps.headline: Apply a layer of Mod Podge to the top of the photo once it dries.
steps.description: Use directional strokes (left to right, right to left, or diagonal) when doing this because the lines will show as it dries.

steps.headline: Allow Mod Podge to dry completely.
Apply two more layers, making sure that each layer dries before doing the next, and allow those to dry.
Spray the tiles.
steps.description: Take the tiles outside and spray the acrylic coating.

steps.headline: Let the spray dry for about 15 minutes and then repeat.
steps.description: Do a total of at least 5 layers to make sure the tiles were completely waterproof.

steps.headline: Cut out pieces of felt and add to the back of the coasters.
steps.description: This will ensure that they will not scratch up your table.
